question: 外れ
sourceMnemonic: The kanji <kanji><ja>外</ja></kanji> alone means "outside." This word means <vocabulary>extremity</vocabulary>. How can you remember this? Just think of the <ja>れ</ja> as a "ray of sunshine." Where you are, in the extremity of space, even the <ja>れ</ja>s of the sun cannot be seen. So, when <ja>外</ja> is combined with <ja>れ</ja> just think of this.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Let's continue the previous story: You're off in the <vocabulary>extremity</vocabulary> of space and your friend is running low on Vitamin D. He <reading>has</reading> (<ja>はず</ja>) to get some sun <ja>れ</ja>s on his skin! How's that supposed to happen with those spacesuits on, though?
